column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Hi Alex - Thanks for the 5 stars! I'm glad you enjoyed our ramen. Your descriptions of our food are spot on
column2: and we are pleased you can appreciate some of the subtleties of our dishes. In regards to the chili paste we use to make a ramen dish spicy -- the chili paste contains more than a dozen different ingredients
column3: and takes quite some time to prepare in large quantities (we use it for all the ramens that are served spicy by default). In essence
column4: it is vastly different from the spicy sauce you'll find on the dining tables. Perhaps the best analogy is asking for sour cream at a Tex-Mex restaurant.
